intro: Brassica oleracea subvar. vulgaris, commonly known as cabbage, is a biennial plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, compact head of tightly packed leaves, which can vary in color from green to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm and has a robust root system. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces round, pod-like fruits containing seeds. This variety is widely cultivated for its edible leaves and is a staple in many cuisines around the world.
